alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 9:18AM EDT until August 30 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Osceola. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 918 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kissimmee, Saint Cloud, West Lake Toho, East Lake Toho, Narcoossee, Lake Kissimmee, Buena Ventura Lakes, Intercession City, Poinciana, Harmony, Osceola Heritage Park, Austin Tindall Park, Campbell, Yeehaw Junction, Alligator Lake, Pine Grove and Kissimmee Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
